titlestmt.titleproper: Rockefeller University records, President, Detlev Bronk, Administrative papers
A Guide to the Rockefeller University records, President, Detlev Bronk, Administrative papers FA140
titlestmt.author: Carolyn Kopp

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-03-07 00:11:11 -0500.

did.unittitle: Rockefeller University records, President, Detlev Bronk, Administrative papers

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) or audiovisual material (audio cassettes, VHS, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Materials requiring specialized equipment for access (film, audio, video, slides) may be closed to research dependent on availability of the applicable equipment
Brittle or damaged items, or materials otherwise in need of preservation care, may be closed to researchers at the discretion of the RAC Head of Archival Services/Head of Reference.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: FA914 Rockefeller University records, President, Detlev W. Bronk, General and Professional correspondence.
FA964 Rockefeller University records, President, Detlev W. Bronk, Biographical and Personal material.
FA965 Rockefeller University records, President, Detlev W. Bronk, Personal and Professional papers.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Rockefeller University records, President, Detlev W. Bronk materials are arranged into 4 components:

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, memoranda, minutes, manuscript notes, photographs, reprints, clippings, budgets, photographs.

This group of D.W. Bronk's papers consists primarily of administrative files kept during his tenure as president of The Rockefeller Institute/ University, 1953-1968. The largest files are: Board of Trustees, Buildings and Grounds, Convocations, and The Rockefeller Institute/University Press. Correspondence of special interest is noted in the right-hand column of the folder listing, and is also indexed by name of correspondent in the card file.

did.physdesc: 3 boxes or 13 inches, [Box 27 is a 2 1/2-inch box]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The material includes one box of clippings from Science, 1954-1968, of articles and Letters to the Editor on science policy issues. Also of note is a collection of 129 reprints and abstract citations of articles by Bronk and his colleagues, 1930-1937. A complete table of contents to the reprints is filed in Box 26, Folder 5.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: This group of papers was delivered to the University Librarian, Mrs. Sonya Mirsky, in January 1981 by Professor Frank Brink, together with some (unprocessed to date) glass slides, and duplicate Bronk reprints.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Articles and letters to the Editor on policy issues.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A collection of 129 reprints and abstract citations, 1930-1937. Originally bound in four 2-hole notebooks, with "Contents" listing author (s) and titles only. Includes DWB and other.
